name: directory_scan-www_cgi_bin-no_credentials_found
description: A comprehensive scan of the www/cgi-bin directory has been completed, examining all CGI scripts, configuration files, and JavaScript files. No hardcoded credentials (such as passwords, API keys, SSH private keys, etc.) or other sensitive information were detected.

name: etc-group-analysis
notes: The group file typically does not contain sensitive credentials and is primarily used for group permission management.

name: hardcoded_urls-remote_management
notes: These URLs may be used for remote device management, and it is recommended to further examine the security of these services.

name: debug_config-remote_management
description: The script sets default debugging levels and firewall configurations, which may impact device security. A debugging level of 2 could expose more log information, while a firewall setting of 0 might disable certain protections.
notes: Debug level set to 2 may expose more log information, firewall set to 0 may disable certain protections

name: service_ports-remote_management
description: The script has set default service configurations, including ports and service names, which may involve sensitive services. The service configurations contain multiple ports that could be used for remote management or file sharing.
notes: The service configuration includes multiple ports, which may be used for remote management or file sharing. It is recommended to check the security of these ports.
